chef_bio: Gordon Ramsay is a professional chef with 10 years of experience in the industry. She specializes in creating hearty, flavorful dishes that are easy to make at home.

recipes.cooking_method: Preheat oven to 400F. Rub chicken with garlic and olive oil, then sprinkle with salt. Stuff cavity with lemon slices. Roast for 1 hour.
In a large pot, brown beef and onions. Add remaining ingredients and enough water to cover. Simmer for 2 hours.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, blend basil, parmesan, pine nuts, and garlic in a food processor until smooth. Toss with pasta.
In a large skillet, sauté onions and garlic until soft. Add eggplant and zucchini and cook until tender. Stir in tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes.

chef_bio: Heston Blumenthal is a self-taught chef who has been cooking for over 20 years. He loves experimenting with different flavors and techniques, and his dishes are always a hit with his family and friends.

recipes.cooking_method: In a large wok, heat oil over high heat. Add shrimp and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and stir-fry for another 2 minutes. Serve with rice.

In a large skillet, brown beef over high heat. Add onion and garlic and sauté until soft. Add broccoli and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Mix soy sauce, cornstarch, brown sugar, and beef broth and add to skillet. Stir-fry for another 2 minutes.

In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and sauté until soft. Add chicken and curry powder and sauté until chicken is browned. Add coconut milk and chicken broth and simmer for 20 minutes.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add pork chops and brown on both sides. Remove chops and set aside. Add onion and garlic to skillet and sauté until soft. Add apples, vinegar, honey, and thyme and simmer for 10 minutes. Return pork chops to skillet and simmer for another 10 minutes.
